Tien Giang is north of the Mekong Delta, adjacent to the Tien River. It is bordered on the north by Long An; on the south by Vinh Long and Ben Tre; on the east by Ho Chi Minh; on the west by Dong Thap.

Tien Giang  has 3 separate regions: a fruit-growing region next to the Tien River, the Dong Thap Muoi region, and the Go Cong coastal region. Tien Giang has a 32 km-long beach which historically has provided a huge fish catch. Tien Giang is one of the regions in Mekong Delta that grows a lot of rice. Also, it is a place known for its fruit: Trung Luong peaches, Vinh Kim star apples, Hoa Loc mangos, Cai Be guavas, and Cho Gao green dragons.

As Tien Giang is one of the most productive farming areas in the Mekong Delta and in the southern economic zone, it is now looking forward to developing a pilot centre for seeds and young plants. The centre will serve as a base for expanding high-tech farming models to the whole of the Mekong Delta.

Tien Giang has 2 seasons: dry and monsoon. The average temperature yearly is 27ºC (80ºF)
Tien Giang Province has one city, one town and 8 districts.

value: for over 200 years the principal town in the province, it was once known as Tay Do. Can Tho has simple, poetic beauty with well-off villages under the shade of coconut trees. On the east bank of Hau River is Ninh Kieu Wharf, which is known for its beautiful location.
is covered by vast rice paddies, shrimp lagoons, luxuriant fruit gardens like longan, rambutan, durian, and oranges.

is encircled by the Tien and Hau Rivers and long coastline, Tra Vinh's economy is based on agriculture, aquaculture, fish and, shrimp farming. The province is covered by verdant plants in garden village along bank of river.
has many pagodas, communal houses. Visitors have chance to walk among the trees, relax in hammocks, try all kinds of delicious tropical fruits in the gardens of An Binh and Binh Hoa Phuoc Islands.

My Tho city is near Vinh Long and Ho Chi Minh City is about 71 km away; Can Tho about 103 km; Chau Doc about 179 km; Rach Gia about 182 km; and Ha Tien about 272 km.

The main road in Tien Giang is Hwy 1A. The My Tho station is on Ap Bac St (5 km from My Tho central city). From Ho Chi Minh City to southern provinces, Mien Tay Bus station has a lot of lines to get to provinces such as Tien Giang, Vinh Long, Chau Doc, Ca mau, Tay Ninh, Can Tho.
From Tien Giang, you can go to Ho Chi Minh City or Phnom Penh by waterways.

value: Express boat: Express boats from Ho Chi Minh City to My Tho City and Can Tho City every day.
Boats travel around My Tho city: Boats on the Mekong take tourists to well-known destinations in My Tho such as Tan Phong Island, Thoi Son Islet.

- Cai Be floating market: this is a main market in the Mekong Delta. This market is on the Tien River. open all day and into the night.  Tourists can find any kind of fruits at this market, and all of them are cheap. Along the river there are many gardens. At night, junks with lighted lanterns which make the river vivid.  

-Take a trip along Tien River: Tourists can visit villages along the river.

- Dong Tam Snake-Breeding Farm: Dong Tam is the centre of snake breeding for taking venom for export, as well as medicinal plant cultivation and the study and treatment of snake bites. There are also crocodiles and other species of birds and animals on hand.

- Vinh Trang Pagoda: Vinh Trang Pagoda is in a large garden in My Phong Commune, My Tho City. The architecture of the pagoda is a harmonious combination of Asian and European types of architecture, creating the splendid, but simple features of this Buddhist pagoda. Vinh Trang Pagoda is the greatest pagoda of Tien Giang Province.
